Comments_List: Helped figure out what I will write my thesis on!
research skills
Gage is an excellent adviser. I especially like that she has her advisees work together to workshop their theses.
Keeping up with deadlines and staying up to date on developing my topic
I was able to get a great grasp on the Taiping revolution and really get to work on my research skills.
I learned about researching and writing long essays.
Have not finished writing it yet, but it will be quite the experience.
- It was helpful for my personal motivation.
I learnt how to conduct a longer research assignment.
I better developed my research skills, both primary and secondary, throughout this process.
Collecting and analyzing primary sources, synthesizing secondary sources and historiography, and doing historical writing

Working on my senior essay has given me in-depth exposure to historical research. So far, this has included getting a really good sense of the historiography on my subject (including library skills such as using WorldCat and requesting ILLs), conducting archival research, and distilling large amounts of information into a manageable argument.
Learning how to organize, research and dive into archives.
Prof Gitlin is the best
honestly the requirements seemed arbitrary
NA
Professor Perdue was a great advisor who helped me greatly in the process. He led me throughout my research, willing to discuss topics and eager to recommend new sources of material.
I like how we have had deadlines along the way.
Good structure to keep you on track for your thesis

The History Department should stop giving seniors pointless milestones and leave it up to them to decide how to prepare for their senior thesis. Requirements like writing ten pages (without first requiring an outline) and a source evaluation are honestly somewhat infantilising to students who have already written long papers before and know their work style better than some guidebook. This course caused me a lot of unnecessary stress this semester.
Professor Wrightson is incredible.

Since there is not a seminar component to the history senior thesis, the assignment deadlines throughout the semester kept me on track for the year long project. I think a few email reminders throughout the semester to set up meetings with one's advisor on a semi regular basis would have been useful as I think those meetings were the most helpful part of the course during the fall semester.

The annotated bibliography assignment came up before I felt like I had a really good sense of all the secondary material I was going to be using for my essay (I still don't) and as such it didn't seem that useful to me.
Strengths: It teaches you to stay organized, work hard and conduct thorough research on a very interesting subject.
Yes! Write a two term paper
sure
NA
Absolutely- it is an incredible chance to really study a topic that you are passionate about!
N/a
Yes, it is also a requirement to graduate.
The senior thesis is a requirement if you want distinction, but every history major should do it  it's a wonderful opportunity!
One would only enroll in this course if they are completing a year long senior thesis, but either way, I gained good insight and skills throughout the process.
Yes, as a requirement for the history major, and as a great opportunity to improve writing and learn about a topic of interest.
Yes.
Yes, I think any history major would benefit from the two-semester thesis.
